intro: Drosanthemum latipetalum, commonly known as the broad-petaled drosanthemum, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, known for their succulent characteristics. The plant features fleshy, thick leaves that help it store water, adapting to arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals that are broad and rounded, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
